chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sexual Assault - Intercourse with Person under 16 - Use/Threat of Force/Violence

result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J Traver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
COMMENCE FORTHWITH.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Conds of extended supervision: no contact with victim, victim's family or victim's workplace which includes no electronic or any other communication or other communication that may be in effect that we don't even know of now that might be in existence seven years from now.  No contact  with victim.  Sexual offender registration for life.  Any counseling required by probation & parole.  AODA and follow through.  Follow all rules of probation.   No contact with any parties under the age of 18 years, whether by employment or otherwise.  No contact with females under the age of 18, excluding members of his immediate family. Defendant may have contact w/all members of his family if approved by DOC, Restrictions on computer, computer for work for extended supervision only not personal use  Computer for work purposes.

ADDRESS INFO for Thomas J Traver
Current: Columbia County Jail 403 Jackson St, Portage, WI 53901   (Effective: 08-31-2016)
Prior: 403 Jackson St, Columbia County Jail, Portage, WI 53901 United States
Filed by ADA Clifford Burdon

3:20 pm/4:19pm. Defendant Thomas J Traver in court, in custody with attorney Michael Hughes.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended information filed.  Reading waived.  Defendant pleads no contest to count 1 of amended information. Court accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty and will enter JOC.  Statement by Atty Hughes.  Statement by Atty Burdon.  Statement by victim's mother.  Statement of victim read my pastor.  Statement by Mr. Traver.  Court imposes: 15 years prison with 7 yrs initial and 8 years extended supervision.  Conds of extended supervision: no contact with victim, victim's family or victim's workplace which includes no electronic or any other communication or other communication that may be in effect that we don't even know of now that might be in existence seven years from now.  No contact  with victim.  Sexual offender registration for life.  Any counseling required by probation & parole.  AODA and follow through.  Follow all rules of probation.   No contact with any parties under the age of 18 years, whether by employment or otherwise.  No contact with females under the age of 18, excluding members of his immediate family. Restrictions on computer, computer for work for extended supervision only not personal use  Computer for work purposes.  Not eligible for challenge incarceration or substance abuse program. Sentence consecutive to any other sentence.  204 days credit.  Sentence to begin forthwith.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 31, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
June 14, 2016 motion hearing filed by Court Reporter Chris Champeau
Bond amended to allow defendant to have supervised contact with his children.
Bond amended to allow defendant to have supervised contact with his children.

Motion for In Camera Inspection of School Records - Court will set a trial date for 2 days, with an hour Motion hearing to hear the Motion for In Camera Inspection and the Motion to Compel Disclosure.
